results.title: Center play. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Willis Reed, star centre of the New York Knicks gives an impressive demonstration of the techniques of rebounding for centres, of blocking out, faking, switching on the “pick”, and proper training techniques. Filmed at Reed’s summer basketball camp.

results.title: Center play. Part 1
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Willis Reed, star centre of the New York Nicks, in the National Basketball Association demonstrates the art of the centre play. Fundamentals of shooting, the push shot, the jump shot, the hook shot, layup and free throw are included. Shows how the little man can gain an advantage in shooting over the bigger man, how shooting can be improved by the proper holding of the ball and concentration of the eye.

results.title: Jo Jo White: offensive guard. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Jo Jo White of the Boston Celtics demonstrates the proper ways to pass and dribble and thus establish the ball control capabilities demanded of a good defensive guard. The chest pass, bounce pass, 2-hand overhead pass, hook pass, baseball pass, dribbling techniques and moving without the ball are all shown.

results.title: Jiri Trnka's puppets
results.brief_description: The art of Jiri Trnka the film puppeteer is cleverly and beautifully presented, showing several extracts from past and forthcoming productions, and including many puppets, some now in `retirement’. Trnka is shown at work in the studio and the mechanics of his art are simply but completely presented. An actual scene under production is discussed and analysed.

results.title: Jingdezhen: China's porcelain capital
results.creator_credit: Ying Xiaoying and China Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the different types of famous Jingdezhen porcelain, the history of porcelain-making in the area and some exquisite examples of both modern and traditional Chinese porcelain.

results.title: Jim Pallas: electronic sculptor
results.creator_credit: Sue Marx and Marx Handley Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working Artists”.
Jim Pallas assembles fantastic sculptures which move and light up as they respond to heat, sound and motion. The film follows Pallas as he creates new pieces, describes finished work and explains the philosophy behind his art. In the final sequence, Pallas attends the unveiling of his latest work which displays intricate light patterns triggered by the movement of dancers.

results.title: Jetflight
results.brief_description: Jetflight is the story of the Trans-Pacific delivery flight of the new Boeing 707 jet airliner. The film shows the great power and size of this luxury air giant on the trip from San Francisco to Melbourne. On stops at the islands of Hawaii and Fiji, it is welcomed by the local people. Once again the airliner takes off on the old Southern Cross route. On arrival at Sydney, the jet has completed its trip in 16 hours cutting by half the usual flying time. Narrated by Martin Royal, script by Ivan Chapman, photography by Bert Nicholas.

results.title: Jennifer is a lady (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a language-development program for two children with a diagnosis of infantile autism. Emphasises methods and techniques used by teachers to foster receptive and expressive language.
